intro: Plagiobothrys undulatus, commonly known as the wavyleaf sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and often have a wavy or undulating margin, giving it its scientific name. Plagiobothrys undulatus is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton.
